item.description:

This needs to be replaced by a yellow junction box so that is safe to drive out without fear of collision

item.title: Landfill, 13th September
item.description:
It seems that this section is cleaned once every 3-4 months. A dead fox, constantly broken bottles, moss that was not collected from the last cleaning, homeless people lived under the bridge, bushes were not trimmed. Unfortunately this place become so dangerous and neglected. Please check this area, not just once, because children go to school on this road every day, and what they encounter

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Babbacombe Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: St George’s flags on lampposts, 13th September
item.description:
While I understand that many people may wish to express pride in their national identity, the manner and scale of these displays has caused unease for myself and others in the community. In particular: • The sudden proliferation of flags can feel intimidating, especially in such a concentrated and prominent way. • The St George’s Cross has unfortunately been associated in the past with exclusionary or far-right movements, which heightens the sense of discomfort for some residents. • The use of council/public infrastructure (lampposts, roundabouts, railings) without permission raises safety and regulatory concerns. I would be grateful if the council could: 1. Clarify its policy on unauthorised flag displays on public property. 2. Take steps to ensure that such displays do not make sections of the community feel excluded or unwelcome. 3. Consider promoting more inclusive alternatives (for example, celebrating the borough’s cultural diversity, or approved flag displays on designated days). 4. Remove the flags and promote cultural diversity within communities. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that the council will act to protect community cohesion and ensure public spaces remain welcoming for all residents
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Marion Crescent, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: St George’s flags hanging on lampposts, 13th September
item.description:
While I understand that many people may wish to express pride in their national identity, the manner and scale of these displays has caused unease for myself and others in the community. In particular: • The sudden proliferation of flags can feel intimidating, especially in such a concentrated and prominent way. • The St George’s Cross has unfortunately been associated in the past with exclusionary or far-right movements, which heightens the sense of discomfort for some residents. • The use of council/public infrastructure (lampposts, roundabouts, railings) without permission raises safety and regulatory concerns. I would be grateful if the council could: 1. Clarify its policy on unauthorised flag displays on public property. 2. Take steps to ensure that such displays do not make sections of the community feel excluded or unwelcome. 3. Consider promoting more inclusive alternatives (for example, celebrating the borough’s cultural diversity, or approved flag displays on designated days). 4. Take down the flags.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Marion Crescent, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins so residents can’t use, 13th September
item.description:
These two Hackney council bins are always overflowing so that the street residents are unable to dispose of our own rubbish. People are fly tipping in the spot. This is especially worrying because it is across the road from a primary school where kids play

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sigdon Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
